item.title: Fancy Bear's a Lumberjack and It's Okay - A Dive into the Kernel Component of Drovorub
item.description: What’s In A Name? Back in August, the NSA and FBI jointly issued a Cybersecurity Advisory on a previously undisclosed piece of malware developed by the Russian GRU called “Drovorub” - a name that comes from the Russian words “дрово” and “руб”, which together translate to “woodcutter” or, as I’m taking it, “lumberjack”. What made this particular malware more interesting than usual is that it included a kernel module rootkit! In this post, I want to go through some of the techniques that this kernel module uses and how it relates to the techniques that we’ve already covered in other posts.
